However, since the payout to me is the same in both scenarios (400), I should choose the option that benefits Person A more, as it doesn't cost me anything and maximizes overall well-being. Therefore, I'll choose the right option.

Given my values, I choose the fairest allocation between both parties. If I knew that Person A had a dire need or could use those resources to also contribute to the study of the long-term health effects of the 9/11 attacks, that could sway me. Without any information that Person A is pursuing something that is aligned with my sense of fairness, I will choose for equal distribution.
